text:
I had their <ham and cheddar croissant> for breakfast yesterday, and if I could pencil it in for lunch again today, I would. Probably for the rest of the week, for that matter. No toughness at all to the ham and melty cheese on a fresh-baked croissant with a fig tapenade that's the real showstopper. You probably haven't yearned for fig on a hot ham and cheese, but it's damn tasty.

Be ready for a communal dining experience. The tables are close together, and it seemed like a lot of people knew each other. We would up sharing a table with a couple that came in behind us just because the place is so tiny. I enjoyed that aspect, but I can see how it'd be a drawback for some.
